title-group.article-title: Characterization of a Semicrystalline Polyimidesulfone Powder

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1989 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: A semi-crystalline polyimidesulfone (PISO₂) material has been synthesized and characterized. Characterization methods include the thermal analysis of DSC, the measurements of inherent viscosities, the wide angle X-ray diffractions, and the viscoelasticities. The melt flow properties of both amorphous and semi-crystal li ne samples were also investigated by means of a parallel plate plastometer. This material was found to be not readily recrystallizable at temperatures above its initial peak melting point of 225°C, when compared to other crystalline thermoplastics. This semi-crystalline PISO₂ demonstrated a flow about 5 times greater than the amorphous one as characterized by the plastometer. Such enhanced melt flow properties could be of great benefit in the adhesive and composite lamination processes.

ref.mixed-citation: Hou, T. H., Bai, J. M. and St. Clair, T. L., "Polymerization and Crystallization Behavior of a LaRC-TPI Powder," J. Appl. Polym. Sci., accepted for publication (1988).
St. Clair, T. L. and Yamaki , D. A., A Thermoplastic Polyimidesulfone," Polyimides, Vol. 1, pp. 99-116, ed. K. L Mittal, Plenum Publishing Corp. (1984)
Instructions Model DSC-2 Differential Scanning Calorimeter, Perkin-Elmer, Norwalk, CT (1979).
Dienes, G. 0. and Klemm, H. F., "Theory and Application of the Parallel Plate Plastometer," J. Appl. Phys., 17, 458 (1946).
Ferry, J. D., "Viscoelastic Properties of Polymers," 2nd ed., John Wiley and Sons, Inc., New York (1970).
